content.question: The first derivative of the function f is defined by <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.7</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>. On what intervals is f increasing?

choices.label: There are no intervals on which f is increasing.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
